metadata.titel_preek: Laodicea, Part III: The Door Of The Soul

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Subject (Hearer) must exercise their unique sovereignty to open the door of the heart to Jesus, who is knocking but cannot enter without human permission.

tekstueel_bewijs: You are in control of something that not even God... can countermand.

object.identificatie: Salvation / Opening the Door / A Philosophy of Life
tekstueel_bewijs: something to give meaning to your years

zender.identificatie: God (as a combination of Judgment and Mercy)
tekstueel_bewijs: The mercy and the judgment, united here in the words of Christ
I thank God that fifty-odd years ago I heard the Lord knocking

helper.identificatie: Memory, Conscience, Mind, Events, and Jesus (as the one knocking)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord knocks on the door of memory
Christ makes sense to the mind!
He'll give you friends, and he'll put food on your table!

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Indifference / Pride / 'Living in the back of the house'
tekstueel_bewijs: maybe they live in the back of the house
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a cosmic power like Sin or Death, but rather a human failure to respond or a lack of focus.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The pursuit of worldly wealth and 'reality' without philosophy.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The 'Fool' / Secretary of Treasury
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher uses secular success as a foil to spiritual success, but both remain centered on the Subject's choice.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will put our sins behind his back.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You are in command of that.
I thank God that I heard it and I answered it.

voorbeelden: We had better not play loose with this.
conscience is that part of us which says you ought
Christ makes sense to the mind!
Your sense will tell you that, won't it?
You are in control of something that not even God... can countermand.
Christ says not only 'you ought,' but also 'you can.'

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment of the will. It assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (power) and merely needs the 'Vouloir' (motivation) to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Judgment) to ~S2 (Warning against cheap grace) to S1 (The invitation to open).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the human act of opening the door, which triggers the transition from Judgment to Mercy.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'spewing' and 'last knock' are used as rhetorical leverage.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using high Christological language, the deep structure is anthropocentric. The hearer is the primary Subject of the salvation event, and God is rendered passive, waiting on human permission.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God is not in control of your decision about your soul's salvation. You are in command of that.
He'll give you friends, and he'll put food on your table!

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: someone who takes our part... someone who takes up for us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher's own conversion and the rancher's response serve as models for the hearer's required action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the one who breaks down the door (Harrowing of Hell) rather than the one who waits for it to be opened.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'act of opening'; anxiety regarding the 'last knock'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human will is the decisive factor.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but structurally incoherent regarding God's omnipotence vs. human will.
spanning_punten: God as Judge vs. God as helpless knocker.
Salvation as a gift vs. salvation as a result of 'not playing loose'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He says his grandmother's face came back before him, because the Lord knocks on the door of memory.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is replaced by 'Memory' and 'Conscience' as psychological helpers.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious, but treatable by a change of mind/will.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' sermon even when speaking of 'Mercy' because Mercy is presented as a conditional reward for the Subject's decision.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'opening' and 'saving'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who 'opens the heart' (as in the case of Lydia in Acts).
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You must open,' use 'Christ is so persistent that He breaks through our defenses to sup with us.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one in control.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'deadness' of the soul (Ephesians 2) so that only God can act.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God enables the hearing of the knock in the first place.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Trivial (living in the back of the house).
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a deadbolt that only Christ can remove.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has immense rhetorical warmth and 'heart,' but it risks leaving the hearer in despair by making God's grace contingent upon the hearer's psychological state.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the pathos and storytelling; Greimas reveals the hearer is doing all the work.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might miss that 'opening the door' has been turned from a metaphor into a legal requirement.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Subject-switch' where God is demoted from Sovereign to a polite visitor.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Decisionism' where the narrative engine is powered by human volition.
